title: Celebrate Holiday (V&K)
description: You declare a day of celebration. Holidays may be religious, historical, martial, or simply festive, but all relieve your citizens from their labors and give them a chance to make merry at the kingdom’s expense. Attempt a basic check, but if your kingdom Celebrated a Holiday the previous turn, the DC increases by 4, as your kingdom hasn’t had a chance to recover from the previous gala.

modifiers.name: Celebrated holiday on the previous turn
modifiers.buttonLabel: +4 DC increase if celebrated holiday on the previous turn

criticalSuccess.msg: Your holidays are a delight to your people. The event is expensive, but incidental income from the celebrants covers the cost. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Loyalty-based checks until the end of your next Kingdom turn.

success.msg: Your holidays are a success, but they’re also expensive. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Loyalty-based checks until the end of your next Kingdom turn. @lose1RolledResourceDice. If you can’t afford this cost, treat this result as a Critical Failure instead.

failure.msg: The holiday passes with little enthusiasm, but is still expensive. @lose1RolledResourceDice. If you can’t afford this cost, treat this result as a Critical Failure instead.

criticalFailure.msg: Your festival days are poorly organized, and the citizens actively mock your failed attempt to celebrate. @lose4ResourceDiceNextTurn. The failure also causes you to take a –1 circumstance penalty to Loyalty-based checks until the end of the next Kingdom turn.
